result.execSummary:
The defendant Henry Anthony Preston was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intimidate Witness [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.42.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by the end of extended supervision in 13CF4877. The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
**1/6/2017  DNA surcharge vacated.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.
Court advised defendant that due to this domestic abuse conviction, he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

Transcript SENTENCING HEARING commencing MARCH 24, 2014 received and filed.  Original transcript in case file 13CF4877 (46 Pages).

Defendant Henry Anthony Preston in court with attorney Bridget J. Krause.  Defendant Henry Anthony Preston in custody.  Molly Marie Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 0 days time served.  Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by the end of extended supervision in 13CF4877.    The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
.
Court advised defendant that due to this domestic abuse conviction, he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
.
Filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
On motion of the state, Court ordered defendant's privileges reinstated.  Order Reinstating Defendant's Telephon/Mail/Visitation Privileges signed and filed.  rmm

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charges dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.
*
AS TO COUNT 3 AS AMENDED:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.:  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Henry Anthony Preston in court with attorney Bridget J. Krause.  Defendant Henry Anthony Preston in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNT 3:  On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Intimidation of Witness, Domestic Abuse, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.42 and 968.075(1)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor.

Defendant Henry Anthony Preston in court with attorney Bridget Krause.  Defendant Henry Anthony Preston in custody.  Molly Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 3/03/14 in Branch 40.  If defense accepts the offer, they are to notify the state by 2/26/14.  Court will reserve ruling on the repeaters until trial.  Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect.

Motion to dismiss the Repeater enhancers as to Counts 1, 2, and 3 by the defense, argued and GRANTED by the Court. Defendant was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Case set for preliminary hearing.  Court is in trial.  Preliminary hearing court agreed to take the matter.  rmm
